The abbot visits the various quarters and hermitages.
Each day he serves tea to show his affection.
Curtains are hung in the monks' hall.
On the first day of the sixth month, in the height of summer, the seat master stops ringing the sitting meditation board.
The hall master in advance issues the list of sutra chanting for the various quarters for the Ghost Festival.
He preempts the funds from the assembly.
He prepares food offerings for the festival.
On the thirteenth day, the Luminous and Utmost Perfection Dharma Assembly is held.
On the fifteenth day, the summer retreat ends.
That evening, the Ghost Festival is held.
Sutras are chanted and food is offered to the hungry ghosts.
On the first day of the eighth month, the overnight accommodation is opened.
The guest master in advance sun-dries the bedding in the quarters.
In this month, the genuine patched-robed monks do not suddenly leave.
The curtains in the monks' hall are taken down.
In the ninth month, on the first day, the chief seat rings the sitting meditation board again.
The hall office arranges for the pasting of the monks' hall windows.
Hang the cool curtains below and the warm curtains above.
On the Double Ninth Day, in the morning, the chief officer burns incense and serves chrysanthemum tea.
The abbot ascends the hall and allows visitors to come and see him.
In the tenth month, on the first day, the stove is opened. The abbot's quarters has a big visit. On the fifth day, it is the anniversary of Bodhidharma.
In the eleventh month, on the twenty-second day, it is the anniversary of the imperial preceptor.
On the winter solstice, the storeroom office prepares glutinous rice cakes and fruits in advance.
In this month, either the office duties are advanced or postponed.
Or it is during the year-end festival.
The abbot's quarters invites the assembly for refreshments before winter.
In the twelfth month, on the eighth day, the Buddha attained enlightenment. The storeroom office prepares red yeast in advance.
At the end of the year, various colored ledgers and books are compiled and presented.
